title: Log In with Role-Based Access
description: As a Registered System User (Technician or Administrator), I want to securely log in to the application using my unique username and password so that I can gain access to the system and use the features and functions authorized for my specific role.
business_value: Ensures that only authorized personnel can access sensitive Protected Health Information (PHI), thereby enforcing security, meeting HIPAA compliance requirements, and enabling the role-based access control model which is fundamental to the system's operation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful login with valid credentials","given":"a user has a valid and active account in the system","when":"the user enters their correct username and password into the login form and clicks the 'Login' button","then":"the system successfully validates the credentials, the login window closes, and the main application window is displayed with features and UI elements corresponding to the user's assigned role."},{"scenario":"Login attempt with an incorrect password","given":"a user has a valid and active account in the system","when":"the user enters their correct username but an incorrect password and clicks 'Login'","then":"the system displays a non-specific error message such as 'Invalid username or password.', the password field is cleared, and the user remains on the login screen."},{"scenario":"Login attempt with a disabled account","given":"a user's account has been disabled by an administrator","when":"the user enters their correct credentials for the disabled account and clicks 'Login'","then":"the system displays a specific error message like 'Your account has been disabled. Please contact an administrator.' and the user is prevented from logging in."}]
technical_tasks: ["Design and Implement User & Role Tables (WI-006)","Implement BCrypt Password Hashing and Verification (WI-008)","Create WPF Login Screen and ViewModel (WI-009)","Implement Core Authentication Service (WI-010)"]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Unit tests for authentication logic implemented with >80% code coverage","A security review of the authentication and password handling code has been completed","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: Enforce Role-Based Feature Access
description: As a system user (Technician or Administrator), I want the application's features and UI controls to be enabled or disabled based on my assigned role, so that I can only perform actions I am authorized for, ensuring system security and compliance with the principle of least privilege.
business_value: Enforces the principle of least privilege, a core security requirement for HIPAA compliance. Prevents unauthorized access to sensitive data and system configurations, reducing the risk of data breaches and operational errors.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Technician role has restricted access to administrative functions","given":"a user is authenticated and has been assigned the 'Technician' role","when":"the user navigates through the application","then":"the 'Administration' main tab/area, and all its sub-features (User Management, System Settings, Audit Trail), must be hidden and inaccessible."},{"scenario":"Admin role has full access to all application functions","given":"a user is authenticated and has been assigned the 'Admin' role","when":"the user navigates through the application","then":"all features, including all Technician-level functions and all administrative functions must be visible and enabled."},{"scenario":"Backend authorization prevents unauthorized actions","given":"a user with the 'Technician' role is logged in","when":"an attempt is made to programmatically invoke an admin-only action","then":"the action must be rejected by the system's business logic layer and the attempt should be logged as a security event."}]
technical_tasks: ["Implement role checks in Application services","Develop dynamic UI visibility bindings in ViewModels"]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Unit tests implemented for the authorization logic with >90% code coverage","Manual exploratory testing completed for both roles to confirm UI state consistency","Story deployed and verified in staging environment"]

title: Automatically Lock Session After Inactivity
description: As a clinician or administrator, I want the application to automatically lock itself after a defined period of inactivity, so that sensitive Protected Health Information (PHI) is protected from unauthorized viewing on an unattended workstation, ensuring compliance with HIPAA security rules.
business_value: Enhances security and ensures HIPAA compliance by automatically securing sessions on unattended workstations, mitigating the risk of unauthorized PHI access and potential data breaches.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Session locks after the configured inactivity period","given":"a user is logged into the application and the inactivity timeout is set to 15 minutes","when":"the user performs no keyboard or mouse actions within the application for 15 minutes","then":"a modal lock screen overlay is displayed, obscuring the entire application window, and the user is prompted to enter their password."},{"scenario":"Inactivity timer resets upon user interaction","given":"a user is logged into the application","when":"the user performs a mouse click, mouse move, or key press","then":"the inactivity timer is reset, and the session remains active and unlocked."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Performance impact of the activity monitor has been measured and is within acceptable limits","Security review confirms the lock screen cannot be bypassed","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: Unlock a Locked Session with Password
description: As a logged-in user whose session has been locked due to inactivity, I want to enter my password into a lock screen overlay so that I can securely unlock my session and immediately resume my work from where I left off, without losing my current application state.
business_value: Ensures HIPAA compliance by protecting PHI on unattended workstations while providing a seamless user experience that maintains workflow continuity and prevents loss of work.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful Unlock with Correct Password","given":"The application session is locked and the lock screen overlay is displayed","when":"The user enters their correct password into the password field and clicks the 'Unlock' button","then":"The lock screen overlay is removed, the application UI is restored to its exact pre-lock state, and the user can resume interaction with the application."},{"scenario":"Unlock Attempt with Incorrect Password","given":"The application session is locked","when":"The user enters an incorrect password and clicks 'Unlock'","then":"An error message 'Invalid password. Please try again.' is displayed, the password field is cleared, and the session remains locked."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Unit tests implemented for the unlock logic","Security requirements validated, including audit logging","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: Create a New User Account
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new user account with a username, temporary password, and role so I can provision access for new staff.
business_value: Enables secure and efficient onboarding of new personnel by provisioning system access with appropriate permissions, which is a fundamental requirement for multi-user operational readiness and security compliance.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Admin successfully creates a new Technician user","given":"I am an Admin logged into the system and on the 'User Management' page","when":"I click 'Add User', enter a unique username, select the 'Technician' role, and click 'Create'","then":"a new user record is created, a 'force password change' flag is set, a secure temporary password is generated and displayed, and the new user appears in the user list."},{"scenario":"Attempting to create a user with a duplicate username","given":"I am an Admin on the 'Add User' form and a user with the username 'jdoe' already exists","when":"I enter 'jdoe' as the username and click 'Create'","then":"the system prevents the creation and displays an inline error message 'Username already exists'."}]
technical_tasks: ["Develop User Management Dashboard UI (WI-012)","Implement 'Create User' Functionality (WI-013)"]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Integration testing completed successfully against a real database","The user creation event is correctly recorded in the audit trail","Passwords are confirmed to be stored using BCrypt hashing"]

title: View a DICOM Study with High Performance
description: As a Technician, I want to open and view a DICOM study with GPU-accelerated rendering and progressive loading, so that I can begin my diagnostic review immediately without waiting for large datasets to load.
business_value: Provides the core clinical functionality of the application, ensuring a fast and responsive user experience that improves diagnostic efficiency and user satisfaction.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Open a large DICOM study with progressive loading","given":"I am viewing the study list and select a 500MB multi-frame study","when":"I open the study for viewing","then":"a low-resolution preview of the first image appears in under 1 second, the UI remains responsive, and the full-resolution image data loads seamlessly in the background."},{"scenario":"Interact with a GPU-rendered image","given":"a DICOM image is displayed in the viewer","when":"I interactively adjust the window/level settings with my mouse","then":"the image updates smoothly in real-time as the calculations are performed on the GPU."}]
technical_tasks: ["Integrate fo-dicom Library (WI-017)","Implement GPU-Accelerated DICOM Rendering (WI-018)","Implement Progressive Loading Strategy (WI-019)"]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Performance benchmarks for loading and rendering are met on target hardware","The viewer correctly displays various monochrome and color DICOM images","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: Manipulate a Viewed DICOM Image
description: As a Technician, I want to use a standard set of image manipulation tools (zoom, pan, rotate, flip, WW/WL), so that I can properly inspect and orient the medical images for analysis.
business_value: Provides essential diagnostic tools that are fundamental to clinical image review, enabling users to focus on specific areas of interest and optimize the image display for better interpretation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Apply zoom and pan to an image","given":"an image is displayed in the viewer","when":"I use the mouse wheel to zoom in and then click-and-drag to pan the image","then":"the image smoothly zooms to the cursor's location and I can navigate the zoomed image by panning."},{"scenario":"Apply window/level presets","given":"a CT image is displayed in the viewer","when":"I select a 'Bone' window/level preset from a dropdown menu","then":"the image rendering immediately updates to the pre-configured window/level values for bone visualization."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","All tools (zoom, pan, rotate, flip, WW/WL) are functional and performant","UI controls and keyboard shortcuts for the tools are implemented","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: Receive Studies from a DICOM Modality
description: As a System, I want to function as a DICOM C-STORE SCP, so that I can receive studies sent from medical imaging modalities and automatically ingest them for local storage and viewing.
business_value: Enables seamless integration into a standard clinical IT environment by allowing the application to receive data directly from modalities, which is the primary method of data acquisition.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Receive a study via C-STORE","given":"the background Windows Service is running and listening for DICOM connections","when":"an external DICOM SCU (e.g., a modality simulator) sends a study to the system","then":"the system accepts the association, receives all DICOM files, saves them to a permanent storage location, and creates corresponding records in the database."},{"scenario":"Handle high-volume C-STORE traffic","given":"the background service is running","when":"multiple modalities send studies simultaneously","then":"the SCP listener accepts the connections, queues the processing for each study via RabbitMQ, and remains responsive without dropping connections."}]
technical_tasks: ["Implement DICOM C-STORE SCP Listener (WI-023)","Decouple Database Writes from SCP via RabbitMQ (WI-024)","Implement RabbitMQ Consumer for DICOM Ingestion (WI-025)"]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Integration test with a DICOM SCU simulator is successful","Performance test confirms the system can handle at least 10 simultaneous associations","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]

title: View the System Health Dashboard
description: As an Administrator, I want to view a real-time System Health Dashboard, so that I can quickly assess the operational status of critical components and proactively identify potential issues.
business_value: Improves system reliability and reduces downtime by providing administrators with a centralized, real-time view of system health, enabling faster troubleshooting and proactive maintenance.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"View a healthy system status","given":"I am logged in as an Administrator and all system components are running correctly","when":"I navigate to the System Health Dashboard in the Administration area","then":"I see green status indicators for the Windows Service, PostgreSQL connectivity, RabbitMQ connectivity, and available disk space."},{"scenario":"View a degraded system status","given":"the RabbitMQ server is offline","when":"I view the System Health Dashboard","then":"I see a red status indicator for RabbitMQ connectivity, a non-zero count in the dead-letter queue, and an overall system status of 'Degraded'."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing","Code reviewed and approved","Dashboard UI accurately reflects the real-time status of all monitored components","The background health checking service is performant and non-intrusive","Story deployed and verified in the staging environment"]
